qas.question: What is the native language of Germans?
What languages is German related to?
What is the most commonly spoken language in the European Union?
What is the dominant language of science?
How many people speak German around the world?
What is the most widely spoken language around the world?

plausible_answers.text: as the dominant language of science-related Nobel Prize laureates

qas.question: Where has German replaced English as the dominant language?
What was English the dominant language of before the 20th century?

context: The native language of Germans is <a0_0>German<a0_0/>, a West Germanic language, related to and classified alongside <a1_0>English and Dutch<a1_0/>, and sharing many similarities with the North Germanic and Scandinavian languages. Spoken by approximately <a2_0><b5_0>100 million<b5_0/><a2_0/> native speakers, <a3_0><b6_0>German<b6_0/><a3_0/> is one of the world's major languages and the most widely spoken first language in the European Union. German has been replaced by <a4_0>English<a4_0/> <b7_0>as the dominant language of <b8_0>science-related Nobel Prize laureates<b8_0/><b7_0/> during the second half of the 20th century. It was a lingua franca in the Holy Roman Empire.
